snippet: Lifting the ban is the latest effort by the Obama administration to reward Myanmar after its president, Thein Sein, began to open the country’s political system and economy in 2011.
abstract: Obama administration lifts sweeping ban on visas for officials from Myanmar, easing sanctions against country despite fears that ethnic violence is threatening country's democracy; lifting of ban, first imposed in 1996, is part of effort to reward Myanmar for opening its political system and economy after decades of military rule.
lead_paragraph: Lifting the ban is the latest effort by the Obama administration to reward Myanmar after its president, Thein Sein, began to open the country’s political system and economy in 2011.

headline.seo: U.S. Lifts Visa Ban on Officials From Myanmar
headline.main: U.S. Lifts Ban on Visas for Burmese Officials
headline.print_headline: U.S. Lifts Ban on Visas for Burmese Officials
